text: Jon Michael Peha (born August 25, 1963) is a full professor of electrical engineering at Carnegie Mellon University. Peha holds a Ph.D. in electrical engineering from Stanford University and BS from Brown University. He is also known for his work at SRI International, Bell Labs, and Microsoft. Peha was a recipient of the Brown Engineering Medal in 1985 and was named a fellow of the American Library Association in 2017. He was named a Fellow of the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) in 2012 for his contributions to wireless and broadband technology for public safety communications. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1963 births Category:Living people Category:American electrical engineers Category:Stanford University alumni Category:Brown University alumni Category:Carnegie Mellon University faculty Category:Fellow Members of the IEEE Category:Place of birth missing (living people)
